data.title: Stall tilt
data.solution:
import sys
import math
concurent=["a","b","c","d","e","f","g","h","i","j","k"]
vitesse=list()
virage=list()
mini=list()
classement=list()
n = int(input())
v = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    speed = int(input())
    vitesse.append(speed)
for i in range(v):
    bends = int(input())
    virage.append(bends)

for r in virage:
    for a in range(56):
        v=55-a
        if 90-math.degrees(math.atan((v**2)/(r*9.81)))>30:
                mini.append(v)
                break
mini.sort()
print(mini[0])
place=0
for element in vitesse:
    nb=chute=0
    for r in virage:
        nb+=1
        if 90-math.degrees(math.atan((element**2)/(r*9.81)))<=30:
            classement.append((nb,element,concurent[place]))
            chute=1
            break
    if chute==1:
        chute=0
    else:
        classement.append((999,element,concurent[place]))
    place+=1
classement.sort(reverse=True)
print("y")
for element in classement:
    x,y,z=element
    print(z)
data.statement:
During motorcycle competitions, the speeds achieved are incredible. But this speed is often the cause of accidents, especially in bends. Indeed, when entering a bend, the motorcycle undergoes the centrifugal force that drives the motorcycle out of the bend. To combat this, riders use a technique called "centripetal tilt" which consists in tilting the bike towards the inside of the bend to compensate for this force. This technique reaches its limits when the speed is too high, which can lead to slippages that lead to falls. Hence the importance of controlling your speed ;)

The purpose of this puzzle is to define the maximum constant speed that your bike must have to pass all the bends of the circuit without stalling and while being the first in the competition. In addition, your job will be to develop the ranking for this competition.

The ranking of this competition is done in this way:
[[V]] = Speed
- If [[Va]] > [[Vb]] > [[Vc]] then {{a}} first, {{b}} second, {{c}} third.
- If [[Va]] > [[Vb]] > [[Vc]] and {{a}} falls then {{b}} first, {{c}} second, {{a}} third
- If [[Va]] > [[Vb]] > [[Vc]] and {{b}} falls at bend 2 and {{a}} at bend 5 then {{c}} first, {{a}} second, {{b}} third
- If [[Va]] > [[Vb]] > [[Vc]] and {{b}} falls at the same bend as {{a}} then {{c}} first, {{a}} second, {{b}} third

In the final ranking, you are also counted and represented by the letter {{y}} (as the goal of this puzzle is that you are the optimal speed you will always be in the first position).

Finally, to know the angle for vertical relation you will need this:
tan([[θ]]) = [[v]]² / ([[r]] × [[g]])
[[v]] = speed (m/s)
[[r]] = radius of the bend (m)
[[g]] = 9.81 (m/s²)
[[θ]] = angle with respect to the vertical (degrees)

A motorcycle will stall if the angle to the ground is less than 30 degrees.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read v:int
loop n read speed:int
loop v read r:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<First line:>> Number [[n]] of motorcycles (other than yours) participating in the competition.
<<Second line:>> Number [[v]] of curves in the circuit.
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> The constant [[speed]] of each motorcycle (The first speed of the list given by the loop is that of competitor {{a}}, the second that of competitor {{b}}, and so on) (m/s).
<<Next [[v]] lines:>> The radius [[r]] of each curve of the circuit (m).
data.outputDescription:
<<First line:>> The maximum integer constant speed to avoid stalling in the circuit.
<<Next [[n]]+1 lines:>> The ranking of the competition.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

During motorcycle competitions, the speeds achieved are incredible. But this speed is often the cause of accidents, especially in bends. Indeed, when entering a bend, the motorcycle undergoes the centrifugal force that drives the motorcycle out of the bend. To combat this, riders use a technique called "centripetal tilt" which consists in tilting the bike towards the inside of the bend to compensate for this force. This technique reaches its limits when the speed is too high, which can lead to slippages that lead to falls. Hence the importance of controlling your speed ;)

The purpose of this puzzle is to define the maximum constant speed that your bike must have to pass all the bends of the circuit without stalling and while being the first in the competition. In addition, your job will be to develop the ranking for this competition.

The ranking of this competition is done in this way:
V = Speed
- If Va > Vb > Vc then a first, b second, c third.
- If Va > Vb > Vc and a falls then b first, c second, a third
- If Va > Vb > Vc and b falls at bend 2 and a at bend 5 then c first, a second, b third
- If Va > Vb > Vc and b falls at the same bend as a then c first, a second, b third

In the final ranking, you are also counted and represented by the letter y (as the goal of this puzzle is that you are the optimal speed you will always be in the first position).

Finally, to know the angle for vertical relation you will need this:
tan(θ) = v² / (r × g)
v = speed (m/s)
r = radius of the bend (m)
g = 9.81 (m/s²)
θ = angle with respect to the vertical (degrees)

A motorcycle will stall if the angle to the ground is less than 30 degrees.
Input
First line: Number n of motorcycles (other than yours) participating in the competition.
Second line: Number v of curves in the circuit.
Next n lines: The constant speed of each motorcycle (The first speed of the list given by the loop is that of competitor a, the second that of competitor b, and so on) (m/s).
Next v lines: The radius r of each curve of the circuit (m).
Output
First line: The maximum integer constant speed to avoid stalling in the circuit.
Next n+1 lines: The ranking of the competition.
Constraints
0 < n, v < 13
0 < speed < 70
0 < r < 200
Example
Input
8
2
56
6
2
23
9
25
41
15
40
30
Output
22
y
h
e
b
c
f
d
a
g
